definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: He got up early this morning, so that he caught the first bus.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上他起的很早，因此趕上了頭班車。

sentences.english: What if she oversleeps and misses the bus?
sentences.chinese: 假如她睡過頭錯過班車怎麼辦？

sentences.english: But the night bus should take you there, so it's not too bad.
sentences.chinese: 但是夜班車也能載你去那兒，所以也不會很糟糕。

sentences.english: Yesterday morning Yang Cheng got up early, so that she caught the first bus.
sentences.chinese: 昨天早上楊成起牀很早，因此，她趕上了早班車。

sentences.english: If you had got up earlier, you would have caught the early bus.
sentences.chinese: 如果你起得早一點，就趕上頭班車了。

sentences.english: If you had got up earlier, you could have caught the early bus.
sentences.chinese: 如果你起得早一點，就趕上頭班車了。

sentences.english: Not catching the last bus , we had to walk home.
sentences.chinese: 沒有趕上末班車，我們只好步行回家。

sentences.english: Hurry up, or you'll miss the early bus.
sentences.chinese: 趕快，否則你就趕不上早班車。

sentences.english: There are also about five long-distance buses daily to Dali and Lijiang.
sentences.chinese: 每天大約有5班長途班車開往大理和麗江。

sentences.english: She missed the early bus so she was late for school.
sentences.chinese: 她沒趕上早班車，所以上學遲到了。

sentences.english: I missed the regular bus, so I had to go to work on foot.
sentences.chinese: 趕上班車，沒奈何只好步行去上班。

sentences.english: She waited at the bus stop until the last bus came in.
sentences.chinese: 她在公共汽車站一直等到末班車進站。

sentences.english: She got up late and failed to catch the early bus.
sentences.chinese: 她起晚了，沒能趕上早班車。

sentences.english: In the happy end on the bus, I met a wage reform.
sentences.chinese: 在快樂的末班車上，我碰上了工資改革。

sentences.english: I'm afraid it's too late to catch the first bus.
sentences.chinese: 趕頭班車恐怕來不及了。

sentences.english: He arrived too late and missed the bus.
sentences.chinese: 他來得太遲而誤了班車。

definition: to take the car, bus, train etc
departure (of a coach or train)/to dispatch a vehicle
to take a taxi (in town)/to hitch a lift
bus/abbr. for 公共汽車|公共汽车[gong1 gong4 qi4 che1]/car belonging to an organization and used by its members (government car, police car, company car etc)/abbr. for 公務用車|公务用车[gong1 wu4 yong4 che1]
to go nonstop to/through (as in "through train")/nonstop
travel time/expected time for a car journey
shuttle bus ferrying passengers between train stations on two different rail lines
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
terminus/final stop on rail or bus line
